Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav scored 68 runs in 40 balls
David Miller scored 59 runs in 46 balls
Aiden Markram scored 52 runs in 41 balls
Lungi Ngidi took 4 wickets for 29 runs
Wayne Parnell took 3 wickets for 15 runs
Arshdeep Singh took 2 wickets for 25 runs
Virat Kohli dropped a catch of Aiden Markram at 35 runs
Hardik Pandya gave 16 runs in the 11th over
Ravichandran Ashwin took out Tristan Stubbs in the 18th over
Rohit Sharma was dismissed by Lungi Ngidi for 15 runs
KL Rahul was dismissed by Lungi Ngidi in the same over
Quinton de Kock was taken out by Arshdeep Singh on the first ball
Rilee Rossouw was dismissed by Arshdeep Singh
Deepak Hooda was dismissed by Anrich Nortje at duck
Virat Kohli was dismissed by Lungi Ngidi
Dinesh Karthik was taken out by Wayne Parnell for 6 runs
Pre-Game Insights: India opted to bat against South Africa in the T20 World Cup 2022
India's playing XI: Rohit Sharma(c), KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Deepak Hooda, Hardik Pandya, Dinesh Karthik(w), Ravichandran Ashwin, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mohammed Shami, Arshdeep Singh
South Africa's playing XI: Quinton de Kock(w), Temba Bavuma(c), Rilee Rossouw, Aiden Markram, David Miller, Tristan Stubbs, Wayne Parnell, Keshav Maharaj, Kagiso Rabada, Lungi Ngidi, Anrich Nortje
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma said 'We have played in such conditions so conditions are not an excuse. We want to be consistent in that department. We could not hold on to our chances, we misses a few run-outs including myself'

David Miller said 'It was pretty nerve-wracking when games get down that close. As a bowler, you can't do much and just have to believe in the boys. This is one of my biggest dreams, to get something like this (award) at the World Cup and help the country win a game. I will cherish it for a long time'
Lungi Ngidi said 'This was one of my biggest dreams: Lungi Ngidi'
Virat Kohli said 'Tough day today but we focus on the next one: Virat Kohli'
Aiden Markram said 'This was one of my biggest dreams: Lungi Ngidi'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Perth, Australia
The Proteas snatched away victory from India's hand in the 2022 T20I World Cup match at Perth
India had made 133 after losing 9 wickets as it chose to bat first
South Africa needed 134 runs in 20 overs to win
The match was a close one, with South Africa winning by 5 wickets
